item.title: 2018: Optimism-corrected treatment effect estimates in subgroups displayed in forest plots for time-to-event outcomes
item.description: Initiated within three month full-time internship at Department of Biostatistics, Roche Basel. Co-supervised with Marcel Wolbers (Roche Basel) and the academic supervisor was Torsten Hothorn, University of Zurich.

item.title: 2016: Joint Modelling of Overall Survival and Progression Free Survival
item.description:
Initiated within four month full-time internship at Department of Biostatistics, Roche Basel. The academic supervisor was Jan Beyersmann, University of Ulm. With this thesis Matthias won the Bernd Streitberg Award 2018 of the German Region of the International Biometric Society.

Paper

item.title: 2014: Estimation from Interval-censored Time-to-event Data: Method Comparison by Simulation based on GALLIUM Study for Follicular Lymphoma
item.description:
Prepared within seven month full-time internship at Department of Biostatistics, Roche Basel. The academic supervisor was Torsten Hothorn, University of Zurich.


Download thesis

item.title: 2013: What does a PSA bounce look like? A numerical and graphical description of the prostate-specific antigen (PSA) bounce phenomenon in patients treated for prostate cancer with brachytherapy only
item.description:
The main outcome of this internship is a R package that is available on CRAN. The main function of the package allows estimation of a Weibull Regression for a right-censored endpoint, one interval-censored covariate, and an arbitrary number of non-censored covariates. Additional functions allow to switch between different parametrizations of Weibull regression used by different R functions, inference for the mean difference of two arbitrarily censored Normal samples, and estimation of canonical parameters from censored samples for several distributional assumptions.

Download SurvRegCensCov from CRAN
Technical report
